organization.description: The GitHub organization name to manage. Use this field instead of `owner` when managing organization accounts.

owner.description: The GitHub owner name to manage. Use this field instead of `organization` when managing individual accounts.

read_delay_ms.description: Amount of time in milliseconds to sleep in between non-write requests to GitHub API. Defaults to 0ms if not set.

token.description: The OAuth token used to connect to GitHub. Anonymous mode is enabled if both `token` and `app_auth` are not set.

write_delay_ms.description: Amount of time in milliseconds to sleep in between writes to GitHub API. Defaults to 1000ms or 1s if not set.

installation_id.description: The GitHub App installation instance ID.

pem_file.description: The GitHub App PEM file contents.

block.description: The GitHub App credentials used to connect to GitHub. Conflicts with `token`. Anonymous mode is enabled if both `token` and `app_auth` are not set.

repository_id.description: Node ID or name of repository

assignees.description: List of Logins for Users to assign to this issue

labels.description: List of names of labels on the issue

members_can_create_internal_repositories.description: Setting to true allows organization members to create internal repositories. Only available to Enterprise Organizations.

default_branch.description: Can only be set after initial repository creation, and only if the target branch exists

block.description: Security and analysis settings for the repository. To use this parameter you must have admin permissions for the repository or be an owner or security manager for the organization that owns the repository.

is_alphanumeric.description: Whether this autolink reference matches alphanumeric characters. If false, this autolink reference only matches numeric characters.

key_prefix.description: This prefix appended by a number will generate a link any time it is found in an issue, pull request, or commit

target_url_template.description: The template of the target URL used for the links; must be a valid URL and contain `<num>` for the reference number

commit_author.description: The commit author name, defaults to the authenticated user's name. GitHub app users may omit author and email information so GitHub can verify commits as the GitHub App.

commit_email.description: The commit author email address, defaults to the authenticated user's email address. GitHub app users may omit author and email information so GitHub can verify commits as the GitHub App.

commit_message.description: The commit message when creating, updating or deleting the file

commit_sha.description: The SHA of the commit that modified the file

overwrite_on_create.description: Enable overwriting existing files, defaults to "false"

sha.description: The blob SHA of the file

labels.description: List of names of labels on the PR

team_slug.description: The slug of the Team within the Organization

team_uid.description: The unique ID of the Team on GitHub. Corresponds to the ID of the github_team_settings resource

algorithm.description: Algorithm to use when determining team members to be assigned to a pull request. Allowed values are ROUND_ROBIN and LOAD_BALANCE

member_count.description: The number of reviewers to be assigned to a pull request from this team

notify.description: Notify the entire team when a pull request is assigned to a member of the team

commit_author.description: The commit author name, defaults to the authenticated user's name

commit_email.description: The commit author email address, defaults to the authenticated user's email address

commit_message.description: The commit message when creating or updating the file

commit_sha.description: The SHA of the commit that modified the file

sha.description: The blob SHA of the file

labels.description: List of names of labels on the PR
